column4: anyone have a clue as to why i cannot connect to the open wireless network thats feet behind my computer?
and airodump says its spewing packets
but it'll try to conenct for about a minute, then just connect to the ethernet conenction
the commands you need are:     sudo iwconfig eth1 essid [ssidhere] key off                  sudo dhclient eth1
the first iwconfig command sets the ssid and the key, the dhclient grabs dhcp address
yeah whatever your interface is called.  mine is eth1
that iwconfig output shows you don't have any ssid set.   pastebin the output of this:   sudo iwlist wlan0 scan
sudo iwconfig wlan0 essid default key off
you're looking for it to say ESSID: "default"  and Associated
ok your ssid is set and you are asociated to that access point.  now you need to get an IP address with "sudo dhclient wlan0"
ok you got an IP!  you are online!
#DHCPACK from 192.168.0.1 <--- that is the dhcp server.  #bound to 192.168.0.111   <-- that is your IP
